Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hostal Aguilar over three periods in June and July 2012. The first room given to us was rather gloomy and painted a sad shade of orange, moreover the AC wasn't effective in the heat of June. On the two other occasions, we had a much nicer pleasanter room with a spacious bath and a good AC . Unlike in other places, the third bed was in a different room of the suite, which made it much more spacious. The staff were friendly and helpful, the location is within half a kilometre of Plaza Sol and the Prado, with a lot of choices of good eating places around. The cost was much lower than what we paid for equivalent accomodation in Rome, Barcelona or Florence. The building and the reception area were not in the best of shape, but the room and the location more than made up for that. Wi Fi was free and fast, which was a great help.

Reviews.Title: “madrid with friends”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Large rooms but old style. Excellent location. Very good for a very short stay with friends. Not for an idyllic trip with girlfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: Buddhakkan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with a lot of anticipation however, we were not disappointed. May be it was because we went with very low expectations. The good part of this hotel: 1.It’s located in the middle of all tourist attractions – Sol, Museum, Plaza Mayor, Palace – all are in walking distance. 2.The reception is always staffed ( 24 hours) . They all speak English and are very helpful. 3.Rooms are of decent size, we had three beds in the room and lots of space for our luggage and to move around. 4.We arrived at 8 AM, our room was ready and we could check in immediately. 5.The room was clean, serviced everyday, bathrooms had basic toiletries if one needed them. 6.There is a vending machine in the lobby where you can get your drinks at normal prices ( which is a rarity in the tourist areas of Madrid) 7.Hassle free air-conditioning which is a rare find even in 3* hotels in Spain. 8.Free internet broadband with very strong signal and it allowed us to log on more than one device at the same time from the room 9.The place is safe and security monitored. Not so nice parts: 1.Our bathroom had an issue with ants, they were swarming all over. 2.The TV was miniscule and I don’t remember seeing any English Channels, but the internet worked great, I logged on to youtube, etc for everything. Verdict- This is not a five star or even a four star and they don’t claim it to be. What they provide is a safe, clean, convenient place to board. We were happy with Aguilar. It didn’t burn a hole in our pockets and met all our needs and more. When I return to Madrid I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for low cost travel”
Reviews.Author: eyequeen
Reviews.Content: Hostal Aguilar is situated in the very center of Madrid between "Sol" and the "Prado" and a few meter from ministry buildings and cafés. It is cheap and basic, but has all the necessary comforts. Clean rooms, sheets, towels. There is no breakfast, but there are many cafés in easy walking distance who offer breakfast from 2,5€ (Café, Croissant, Orange Juice) or the "very Spanish" Chocolate con Curros which you should try at least once during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend with friends”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay at a very central location. Both the city-center with restaurants and cafés and the museums are at walking distance. The room was clean and the beds were good. The metro is nearby so the hostel is easy to reach from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “basic but clean hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: marikasalomons
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 5 person bedroom, Very clean hotel, helpfull staff and great location. & minutes walking from metro if you need one, because the hotel is right in the center. Almost next door is a theatre that shows The Carmen Bizet ballet flamengo show. Great deal recommended

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location, good price!”
Reviews.Author: Tatsiana_by
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 2.00 am without any reservation (we had a trouble with the place we reserved and had to look for something just there and then). There were several hostals in same building and this was the one that happened to have a spare room. They told us right away, that it will be double beds, and of course at 2 at night we didn't wan't to be very choosy :D. The room was very nice and big, clean bathroom, air-conditioning. The bathtub looked very old though, with broken enamel. But honestly, it didn't bother at all - the shower worked perfectly, and it was clean. TV and a small sofa, though the room's planning makes them useless - its impossible to lay on a bed and watch TV. The housekeeping stuff is very nice - even if we left the room at 14, we would find our beds made and towels changed. I left them some cents on the bed first day, and when we came back, my coins were carefully folded on a bedside table. The room had a very nice shutters, so it was dark in the room as it was night even in the afternoon - my boyfriend loved it, as he just cannot sleep with ANY light, and we were coming back home at 5 - 7 am. No any noise, only maybe from around 10am some moving out people. But no noise made it to the room from the street, which was very nice. Very nice surprise was a free wifi! There was no breakfast in the hotel, but we found a great deal from cafe Rodilla just on Puerta del Sol - 3 euro for coffee and hot sandwich + fresh orange juice for just 1 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great price”
Reviews.Author: MartaGaspar
Reviews.Content: I booked this hostal after readinh the reviews on tripadvisor. I stayed with some friend for 5 days. The rooms are simple and comfortable. This is obviasly not a five stars hotel but was clean, confortable and perfect for the price. I would recommend this hostal for everyone is a short budget. Negative points: Do not have breackfast

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: TartanBadger
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed there on a long weekend in Madrid and loved this place. The room was a good size (not just the bed + 1' on all sides), the bed was comfy, and the bathroom had a full-sized tub (extremely rare in lower-priced hotels). Very inexpensive as well. Two minor downsides - the doors are super-thin and sounds carry down the hallway very well. Our room overlooked an interior courtyard and there's a restaurant on the ground level that was a little noisy until around midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Basic Hotel, Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: simone65l
Reviews.Content: Hostal Aguilar exceeded my expectations of a basic economy hotel. Reception was exremely helpful and accommodating. I had a single room ensuite that was very clean and comfortable. The location, only a few minutes walk to the prado / park and thyessen, and in the heart of the city, was truly a wonderful surprise. And being a few blocks from the metro makes hopping to any other section you don't want to walk to extremely easy. I would stay here again in a minute and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location + All is ok”
Reviews.Author: cgiderler
Reviews.Content: Hostel is just in the center of Madrid. Its Only 3 minutes walk to Puert del Sol. Stuff was friendly; can talk English. Rooms were clean and quiet. As its name is an hostel i can say its bigger and confortable than many 3 stars. tv and safebox in the room. There is an internet pc (with a reasonable price) and a coffee-cold drinks and snack automats in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: pipedreamer
Reviews.Content: The Aguilar exceeded our expectations. Excellent value, as good a location as you would wish for, comfy beds, a lovely balcony and surprisingly quiet. I would recommend this hostel to anyone looking for a good basic bed for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for art lovers”
Reviews.Author: mairingrant
Reviews.Content: I have been taking a group of art students to Madrid for many years and we always stay in Hostal Aguilar. One reason is that it is very afordable for students, especially if they share. Secondly it is within a short walking distance of The Prado, Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza and the Reina Sofia gallery. The railway station is also a short walk away. The rooms are clean and towels are supplied. This family run establishment is consistent and the same helpful and friendly people are there year in year out. Value for money and convenience is why I have given this hostal five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, not luxury accomodation by any stretch of the imagination, but they don't claim to be offering that. Very basic, but always clean. Room is spacious enough with a full bathroom. Air conditioned with TV, although the TV didn't always work (but I didn't care). Location is great and an easy walk to most areas of interest and the Metro. Very close to Puerta de Sol. Safe area. No direct elevator to your floor...I was on the third floor and had to walk up each time...I didn't mind, but keep this in mind if that bothers you. If you're on a budget and are looking for very basic, clean accomodation, this is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Hostal Aguilar”
Reviews.Author: amunoz64
Reviews.Content: These rooms were clean! As far as the accomodations, they were adequate. But the price and location well made up for any amenities it lacked. There are quite a few eating establishments very near. Shopping was very close. Attractions were a very easy walk from this location! We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Much like a college dorm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hostal Aguilar is on the second floor of C. San Jeronimo. A great location, it is the perfect place to stay for people on budgets. It's really easy to get around the city, either by walking or using the subway(Sol & Sevilla are the closest metro stops). There are shops and restaurants close by, and people constantly walking around. It is a safe and well lit neighborhood, even at 1AM. If you can't find what you need on San Jeronimo, El Sol is two blocks away and has everything you could want. The hotel itself is quite dark and spartan. It is much like a college dorm room, with plush couches in the main hall and brown speckled floors or linoleum tiles in the hallways and rooms. The beds are so uncomfortable and very basic. My sheets didn't even extend all the way to the end of my bed. The bathroom is exceptionally clean and was my favorite part about the hotel. Hemingway stayed here in room 107(I believe that is the number....it is the room straight across from the reception desk), which is a fun factoid and consoles you amidst the bleakness of the decor. The staff is very friendly and helpful about Madrid and the local area...and there is a lockout of the main door after 11, so ring up to the front desk if those glass doors are shut. It's a great safety precaution and definitely made me feel more safe. It made me depressed to stay in such a dark place, but it has its redeeming qualities. If you can deal with the dimly lit rooms and hallways and the spartan decor, this is a great deal for travelers in Madrid.

HotelInfo.Name: Hostal Aguilar
HotelInfo.Address: c/ Carrera de San Jeronimo, n0 32 , 20, 28014 Madrid, Spain
